flixel.util.FlxVelocity

type
class

Static Methods

accelerateTowardsMouse(Source : flixel.FlxSprite, Speed : Int, MaxXSpeed : Int, MaxYSpeed : Int) : Void

parameters
Source The FlxSprite on which the acceleration will be set
Speed The speed it will accelerate in pixels per second
MaxXSpeed The maximum speed in pixels per second in which the sprite can move horizontally
MaxYSpeed The maximum speed in pixels per second in which the sprite can move vertically
Sets the x/y acceleration on the source FlxSprite so it will move towards the mouse coordinates at the speed given (in pixels per second)
You must give a maximum speed value, beyond which the FlxSprite won't go any faster.
If you don't need acceleration look at moveTowardsMouse() instead.

accelerateTowardsObject(Source : flixel.FlxSprite, Dest : flixel.FlxSprite, Speed : Int, MaxXSpeed : Int, MaxYSpeed : Int) : Void

parameters
Source The FlxSprite on which the acceleration will be set
Dest The FlxSprite where the source object will move towards
Speed The speed it will accelerate in pixels per second
MaxXSpeed The maximum speed in pixels per second in which the sprite can move horizontally
MaxYSpeed The maximum speed in pixels per second in which the sprite can move vertically
Sets the x/y acceleration on the source FlxSprite so it will move towards the destination FlxSprite at the speed given (in pixels per second)
You must give a maximum speed value, beyond which the FlxSprite won't go any faster.
If you don't need acceleration look at moveTowardsObject() instead.

accelerateTowardsPoint(Source : flixel.FlxSprite, Target : FlxPoint, Speed : Int, MaxXSpeed : Int, MaxYSpeed : Int) : Void

parameters
Source The FlxSprite on which the acceleration will be set
Target The FlxPoint coordinates to move the source FlxSprite towards
Speed The speed it will accelerate in pixels per second
MaxXSpeed The maximum speed in pixels per second in which the sprite can move horizontally
MaxYSpeed The maximum speed in pixels per second in which the sprite can move vertically
Sets the x/y acceleration on the source FlxSprite so it will move towards the target coordinates at the speed given (in pixels per second)
You must give a maximum speed value, beyond which the FlxSprite won't go any faster.
If you don't need acceleration look at moveTowardsPoint() instead.

accelerateTowardsTouch(Source : flixel.FlxSprite, Touch : flixel.system.input.touch.FlxTouch, Speed : Int, MaxXSpeed : Int, MaxYSpeed : Int) : Void

parameters
Source The FlxSprite on which the acceleration will be set
Touch The FlxTouch on which to accelerate towards
Speed The speed it will accelerate in pixels per second
MaxXSpeed The maximum speed in pixels per second in which the sprite can move horizontally
MaxYSpeed The maximum speed in pixels per second in which the sprite can move vertically
Sets the x/y acceleration on the source FlxSprite so it will move towards a FlxTouch at the speed given (in pixels per second)
You must give a maximum speed value, beyond which the FlxSprite won't go any faster.
If you don't need acceleration look at moveTowardsMouse() instead.

moveTowardsMouse(Source : flixel.FlxSprite, ?Speed : Int, ?MaxTime : Int) : Void

parameters
Source The FlxSprite to move
Speed The speed it will move, in pixels per second (default is 60 pixels/sec)
MaxTime Time given in milliseconds (1000 = 1 sec). If set the speed is adjusted so the source will arrive at destination in the given number of ms
Move the given FlxSprite towards the mouse pointer coordinates at a steady velocity If you specify a maxTime then it will adjust the speed (over-writing what you set) so it arrives at the destination in that number of seconds.
Timings are approximate due to the way Flash timers work, and irrespective of SWF frame rate. Allow for a variance of +- 50ms.
The source object doesn't stop moving automatically should it ever reach the destination coordinates.

moveTowardsObject(Source : flixel.FlxSprite, Dest : flixel.FlxSprite, ?Speed : Int, ?MaxTime : Int) : Void

parameters
Source The FlxSprite on which the velocity will be set
Dest The FlxSprite where the source object will move to
Speed The speed it will move, in pixels per second (default is 60 pixels/sec)
MaxTime Time given in milliseconds (1000 = 1 sec). If set the speed is adjusted so the source will arrive at destination in the given number of ms
Sets the source FlxSprite x/y velocity so it will move directly towards the destination FlxSprite at the speed given (in pixels per second)
If you specify a maxTime then it will adjust the speed (over-writing what you set) so it arrives at the destination in that number of seconds.
Timings are approximate due to the way Flash timers work, and irrespective of SWF frame rate. Allow for a variance of +- 50ms.
The source object doesn't stop moving automatically should it ever reach the destination coordinates.
If you need the object to accelerate, see accelerateTowardsObject() instead Note: Doesn't take into account acceleration, maxVelocity or drag (if you set drag or acceleration too high this object may not move at all)

moveTowardsPoint(Source : flixel.FlxSprite, Target : FlxPoint, ?Speed : Int, ?MaxTime : Int) : Void

parameters
Source The FlxSprite to move
Target The FlxPoint coordinates to move the source FlxSprite towards
Speed The speed it will move, in pixels per second (default is 60 pixels/sec)
MaxTime Time given in milliseconds (1000 = 1 sec). If set the speed is adjusted so the source will arrive at destination in the given number of ms
Sets the x/y velocity on the source FlxSprite so it will move towards the target coordinates at the speed given (in pixels per second)
If you specify a maxTime then it will adjust the speed (over-writing what you set) so it arrives at the destination in that number of seconds.
Timings are approximate due to the way Flash timers work, and irrespective of SWF frame rate. Allow for a variance of +- 50ms.
The source object doesn't stop moving automatically should it ever reach the destination coordinates.

moveTowardsTouch(Source : flixel.FlxSprite, Touch : flixel.system.input.touch.FlxTouch, ?Speed : Int, ?MaxTime : Int) : Void

parameters
source The FlxSprite to move
speed The speed it will move, in pixels per second (default is 60 pixels/sec)
maxTime Time given in milliseconds (1000 = 1 sec). If set the speed is adjusted so the source will arrive at destination in the given number of ms
Move the given FlxSprite towards a FlxTouch point at a steady velocity If you specify a maxTime then it will adjust the speed (over-writing what you set) so it arrives at the destination in that number of seconds.
Timings are approximate due to the way Flash timers work, and irrespective of SWF frame rate. Allow for a variance of +- 50ms.
The source object doesn't stop moving automatically should it ever reach the destination coordinates.

inline velocityFromAngle(Angle : Int, Speed : Int) : FlxPoint

parameters
Angle The angle (in degrees) calculated in clockwise positive direction (down = 90 degrees positive, right = 0 degrees positive, up = 90 degrees negative)
Speed The speed it will move, in pixels per second sq
returns
A FlxPoint where FlxPoint.x contains the velocity x value and FlxPoint.y contains the velocity y value
Given the angle and speed calculate the velocity and return it as an FlxPoint

velocityFromFacing(Parent : flixel.FlxSprite, Speed : Int) : FlxPoint

parameters
Parent The FlxSprite to get the facing value from
Speed The speed it will move, in pixels per second
returns
An FlxPoint where FlxPoint.x contains the velocity x value and FlxPoint.y contains the velocity y value
Given the FlxSprite and speed calculate the velocity and return it as an FlxPoint based on the direction the sprite is facing
